text: hi everybody I'm Brandon today we're
gonna talk a little bit about AWS
communities
user groups and how you can get involved
I'm joined by Jenn and Colby Jenn can
you introduce yourself my name is Jenn
Doyle I'm from one strategy and I lead
women in tech AWS community groups in
Seattle in Salt Lake City
Kolby hi I'm Colby Allen I'm from zip
whip I help co-lead the AWS engineers
and architects meetup here in Seattle
great Jon can you tell me a little bit
about what the format of these meetups
is like yeah so our meetup is usually
50/50 between presentations from women
in tech who are either a funding project
they're working on a particular service
or tool that they're checking out and
have something fun that they're showing
off and then the other half we do small
breakup groups where you kind of do a
lot more peer-to-peer sharing and
getting inspired what other people are
working on or be able to pick their
brains and kind of talk more on really
specific topics that are interesting you
cool it sounds like a lot of fun Colby
what benefits can people get by joining
an attending the meetups that you run
well I don't think there's a lot of
benefits you mean you have as Jen said
we have technical talks at ours so you
gain that information there but also the
networking that happens beforehand and
after we have a lot of people will come
to our meetup with problems or questions
for the group and discuss that with
people around bounce ideas off each
other and really you know try to figure
out the best way to do things and
leverage the hive mind that is available
there great
Jenn can you tell me a little bit more
about the women and tech focused events
that you run yeah so we try to drive
women a tech environment where we have
our speakers or women and tech who
either are working on a really cool new
project that they are willing to share
or from a company that's doing some
really exciting things and it's really
open to anybody they're free for
anything from students to people who are
leading teams and just wanting to learn
and see what other people are doing we
also have a slot channel for anybody who
shows up or has interest to kind of be
able to have more of a networking
peer-to-peer sharing on that side as
well great so there are over 300 AWS
communities and user groups around the
world there's probably one happening
near where you are most of them are run
by awesome community minded folks
like Jen and Colby and they're usually
free to attend so get involved find the
local community that's near you and you
can get started at aws.amazon.com slash
user groups thanks for joining us
